meanings.definition: To create again; to reconstruct or rebuild.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, they had to recrate their sandcastle.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to recrate her masterpiece for the art show.
meanings.sent3: He tried to recrate the cake he saw on TV, but it turned out funny.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to recrate the magic of their first date.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to recrate the experiment to get accurate results.

meanings.definition: To pack or store items in a crate for transportation or storage.
meanings.sent1: They needed to recrate the fragile dishes before moving.
meanings.sent2: The workers will recrate the products before shipping them out.
meanings.sent3: He had to recrate the toys in the box, making sure they fit.
meanings.sent4: She had to recrate the memories of her childhood into boxes.
meanings.sent5: The team will recrate the equipment carefully to avoid damage during transport.
